result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas Anthony Kesler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes:
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Provide DNA sample & pay surcharge.

No possession or consumption of alcohol, controlled substances or prescription medication unless prescribed by a Dr. and then only according to Dr.'s orders.
No contact with property owner, J.N.
Assessments and counseling as determined by agent.

timeConds.notes:
No credit.
No good time.
Huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations.
May serve in any other county.
